entries.title: Alien Parasite
entries.description:
Alright, so, this was my first LD48 ever and let me just say... IT WAS CRAZY!

I will never think to myself, "That's all they could do in 48 hours?" ever again. Phew!

Let me just say, I really only had 24 hours to work on this competition. For the entire first day I was learning Actionscript 3 and the Flixel library as I had never really used either before. I spent that time doing tutorials and such and really only began working on my game around 10pm Saturday, or 24 hours in. See the time lapse if you don't believe me! :P

Anyway, I am entering my game in the competition, but to be fair I'm not sure it even qualifies as a game seeing as you cannot win. Or perhaps I am just sadistic, haha.

What you will experience when you play the game is the beginning of an idea, and concept for the theme "enemies as weapons." The idea is you are an alien parasite who controls humans, but they can only survive so long with you in their body. You will notice that the life counter turns red at different periods for different humans. This is because I wanted to implement a mechanic where humans would start to attack you once you showed signs of infection (once the number turns red). Well, really only the army guy would attack you.

Also, I was going to make it so outside of a different pain tolerance (level when you start to show signs of infection), each human had a special ability. The army guy could shoot, medic could heal others (to help you reuse them easier), and the tech could use computers which would open doors. Combined I thought these mechanics plus some good level design would go together to make some pretty cool levels and an overall nifty idea.

I definitely plan to further flesh out this idea after I rest from the weekend, and hope to have a much more polished and playable version available in the near future.

A HUGE thanks to everyone from the Ludum Dare community, and also to the people in the #flixel channel on freenode. They were a big help while learning the library. I look forward to the next LD48 in 4 months.

Take care,
ItzMattu
http://gdg.uml.edu

entries.title: Alien Super Mega Blaster
entries.description:
Alien Super Mega Blaster (named by my son) is a take on Space Invaders.  

The theme is incorporated by the fact aliens do not fire back, but attack in response to you firing on them and spraying shrapnel in attempt to kill you.  This shrapnel also kills the aliens and you can get a score multiplier for a cascade death by knocking out one of the large ships.

Some bugs for sure and would certainly like to improve the collision detection as this has been implemented for time to code.  Pixel perfect will certainly be on the cards.

To run this you will need either the XNA studio 3.1 or the XNA redist from the link below:

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=53867A2A-E249-4560-8011-98EB3E799EF2&displaylang=en 

If running this game is not possible as you either do not want to or can not install XNA, then I have updated a video of the submitted version here:

http://tinyurl.com/2639hyw


Have fun and would love some feedback.

entries.title: March of the Rorgers
entries.description:
Hello! Me and my friend Pete made this game below in 70ish hours, from scratch in Delphi.


MARCH OF THE RORGERS - HOW TO PLAY
==================================

PREMISE
-------
Bobbing up and down at the top of the screen is the blue Orb. Defend it at all costs. It is surrounded by four laser towers which provide some limited defence. HOWEVER! Those towers alone are nowhere near powerful enough on their own to halt the march of the Rorgers. Instead, you will have to rely on the building abilities of the little crab-like Builder Bot sitting in your base. The key is to turn the enemies against each other. Here's how:


BUILD MENU
----------

Commands are executed mainly through the Build Menu, which is accessed by clicking anywhere on the terrain (except for the Orb). There are three types of command, and executing multiple commands in quick succession will cause the commands to be queued up.

-SALVAGE-
Your Builder Bot is capable of collecting resources from the land. Rocks and buildings can be salvaged by clicking on them in the terrain and selecting the 'GET' icon. Resources are important; without them there's only a limited amount that you can build. You can see how many you have in the top right corner of the screen. 

-SIGNS-
Your bot is capable of building four types of signs pointing up, down, left and right. Each sign costs 10 resources and you may only build 3 signs per builder bot you have in your possession. Click where you would like to build and the build menu will appear. Select the sign you want from it, and your bot will go to work. 

A sign may not be placed directly near another sign; when the build menu is up you will see a red radius around locations where you cannot build.

-DESTROY-
Clicking on a sign and then the hammer icon will send your Builder Bot to destroy it, for when it is no longer useful or you need to free up sign slots.


THE ORB
-------

The Orb that you are guarding is a special case, as clicking on it gives you the chance to build an extra Builder Bot. Having extra builders is good because it increases your sign limit and allows more commands to be executed simultaneously, but it comes at the relatively hefty price of 50 resources.


THE RORGERS
-----------
There are 3 different types of Rorgers; Stress Rorgers (Red), Envy Rorgers (Green) and Fear Rorgers (Black). All have the common goal of destroying your Orb but different types of Rorgers do not get along. You must use this to your advantage by guiding them into conflict with each other via the signs you build. 

Rorgers begin at the bottom of the screen, emerging from their deployment tubes, and work their way upward before converging on your base.

Signs will cause Rorgers to change direction when encountered, but they will not be fooled forever. After a while, unless they encounter another sign they will realise they have been led astray and head back towards your orb. 

IMPORTANT: Each Rorger will only be fooled by the same sign once, so don't expect the same trick to work twice.

You can see on the right side of the screen a chart that indicates which type of Rorger will attack which. But be warned: this may change occasionally as a result of the volatile Rorger political situation that is beyond our comprehension. 

TIP: Be wary of those sneaky Fear Rorgers - they like to attack your base from the sides!

---

Good Luck, and we hope you enjoy the game!

Love from,
Surprised Man

entries.title: Protractor
entries.description:
My entry is called "Protractor", it's a katamari shmup!  You WILL need the latest version of DirectX!  Update if you see a missing dll errors.  I also put up a link to an enhanced version with some post-deadline bug fixes and gameplay tweaks.  Enjoy!

Gameplay Help

- Kill enemies and collect their parts to build.  
- Use left mouse to pull parts to you to attach them.
- Colors indicate health level.  Purple is super high health, red is about to die.  Your ship will auto recharge health but other parts wont, unless you have a healer attached.
- Weapons are randomized but all have the same DPS so on average they will cause the same amount of damage. Larger bullets represent more damage.
- Try to keep your ship balanced or it will become difficult to control.  Use engine placement to help balance things out.
- Triangle - Weapon (random but normalized to the same DPS)
- Square - Healer (auto repairs ship and attached parts)
- Pentagon - Speed Booster (increases speed and turn rate)
- Circle - Extender (allows for expansion)

Controls

- Left mouse - Move parts
- Spacebar or Right mouse - Shoot
- WASD - Move your ship
- Alt+Enter - Go fullscreen (recommended)

Tools Used
- Visual C++ 2010 Express
- Frank Engine (my open source game engine)
- Box2d physics
- SFXR and Audacity for sound effects
- GIMP for image editing
- Tortoise SVN for revision control

entries.title: Psi Keepers
entries.description:
Introduction
------------
In PSI keepers you control a special PSI powered unit with the arrow keys
(or WASD). There will be many suicide bombers trying to run into you and
kill you. Move out of their way and target them with the mouse. Once 
targeted, press and hold the left mouse button down to assume control of
one of the bombers. The bomber moves to where the mouse cursor is, so
move the bomber against another bomber, so they both explode. Try to
survive as long as possible


Requirements
------------
Windows XP/Vista/7
.NET Framework 3.5


Credits
-------
Done by Jere "XMunkki" Sanisalo

Visual Studio 2010 C# Express was used to make this production.
DrPetter's 'sfxr' utility was used to create the sound files.

Licenced under the GPLv2.

entries.title: Rainbow Hero
entries.description:
A fairly simple arcade puzzler, where you have to possess zombies and then use their abilities as weapons.

Linux and Windows have been tested to work with Java Web Start (JRE 6 required).

Just a clarification of the controls:
  ARROWS: Move
  SPACE: Fire ability (most abilities take some time to work
         so you need to hold it down)

entries.title: Sonic Boom
entries.description:
Move your ship with the arrow keys or WASD, move the mouse to aim, left click to fire. Your ship's weapons are powered by the sound made by the cyan/magenta/yellow wave enemies. If you keep close to them you'll get stronger shots, if you kill them you'll lose your weapons until they respawn (though on the bright side the music will be slightly less painful until they do). One touch with any enemy (wave or ordinary), and it's game over.

The post-LD version (d6) doubles the bullet speed and fixes one of the enemy graphics. If you're judging the game for the competition, please judge the compo version. :)

entries.title: Sporg
entries.description:
Navigate fiendish maze-like maps! Travel unarmed! See many walls! Beware evil throbbing red enemy spheres equipped with spotter lasers and deathshots! Wonder why the game is called Sporg! Enjoy amazing stereo sound effects, and strain to hear abstract, possibly non-existent music track! 

Update: fixed the truncated mapfile from the initial upload that broke maps from 6 onwards

entries.title: The South and the North suck yorkshire puddings! I'm from the Midlands me!
entries.description:
The South and the North suck yorkshire puddings! I'm from the Midlands me! is a harmless madlibs type creation centered on a fictional war between Northern and Southern England.

You play a couple of generals from the Midlands who decide to compile propaganda to encourage the North and the South to wage war on each other, rather than you.

There are four possible endings try and get them all :)

No offence is intended through this game and it was all made in good fun, I myself am from the South of England, and my partner is from the North, and find the game entertaining by many standards.

Made with Game Maker 8.

Also @greasemonkey's comment, I was not under the influence when I was making this game, just overly tired, I'm quite please with what my result was considering I was working the whole of sunday and so only made it in about 20 or so hours.

Oh yes, and graphically it is supposed to look pants, I'm not an artist, maybe you might see it as charming... I don't.

Oh, and be warned there is some swearing involved in the game, and some rude outcomes, I was going to make it a little more friendly, but I did not have the extra time.

entries.title: The Strings That Bind the World
entries.description:
"Your father built the greatest empire this world has ever seen, but he never saw its true potential.  Now it's your turn.

We await your command, and the world awaits your lash."

Risk style game, where your opponents are ridiculously powerful but you can use diplomacy to coerce your opponents into fight each other.

Revision 175 is the final one as of the end of the Jam (half playable, but throughly unfinished).

Need SFML, G++, Lua5.1 to compile; and bazaar to get the source.  On Linux, ./waf configure build will configure and build the game. ./waf run will run it.

A more complete version of the game, plus Windows, Linux, and OSX binaries are upcoming.

entries.title: Bac-Attack
entries.description:
You are the virus, as an infected you can infect others, which will then carry your virus giving them the ability to unknowingly infecting others.

But be careful, watch out for the antibacterial spray!

Made in GameMaker 8 as I cannot code well at all :)

*I apologise for the size of the download, I also apologise if anyone gets lag from the game, it plays fine on my computers but I didn't have a chance to test it on any other machines.

After looking at my game for a second without stress I've come to realise maybe the types of bacteria should switch colours in a later version in the future, as the healthy bacteria current have red tails

*UPDATE* 23/08/2010

Thanks to everyone for the great comments, after reading your comments it's made me realise how little explanation the game gives and it raises way more questions than I thought it would.

After thinking about it, it would have worked nicely if I had the infected bacteria leave a trail of virus behind it, and then if the ones that have been infected do the same, so the spray then removes that when it's hit. There's a lot more I could do with it, but I'm still fairly happy with what it turned out like, even if the main goal is score based.

entries.title: Daremon
entries.description:
(Disclaimer: This is a long game, I decided to make a whole RPG with a beginning, middle and end. As a result I have been unable to test it thoroughly enough so I cannot guarantee that winning the game with the current set of rules is feasable. Also there's no save feature, which is necessary for such a long game. I hope to make a Jam version with this in.)

DAREMON - A Pokemon Spoof

-Overworld controls-
Arrow keys - move
Space/return - confirm/look/talk

-Battle controls-
Mouse driven.

You can carry one Daremon at a time. To get a better one, find a wild one and try to capture it. The weaker the Daremon the higher chance of capture!

Good luck!

entries.title: Fight Chickens With Chickens
entries.description:
Yay my first ActionScript thingie :)

but, to the point...

Your farm has been overridden by some strange space zombie chickens. Destroy their nests and free your homeland!!!

But....

Since you're just a chick, you cannot attack chicken, so you have to gather eggs which contain them. When you're armed with eggs, you can distract chickens by throwing other chickens at them and steal their nests!!!

You can also destroy chicken that you threw automatically by placing self-destrucion device in them. And it's all done automagically!

So go, and get rid of them chickens with chickens!

Controls:
Arrows - move
1-6 - select chicken
Z - jump (hold to stick your head to the ceiling)
SPACE - throw chicken
BACKSPACE - kill chickens you threw

EDIT: I just found out that level design makes it impossible to beat the game. You can collect only 12 out of 14 nests, but since nothing happens in the end, i guess it doesn't matter.

entries.title: Grandfather glasses
entries.description: An adventure game where you create equipment out of enemies to find your grandfather's glasses.

entries.title: Graviton
entries.description:
Manipulate gravity to cause shapes to crash into each other.
Make sure you don't run into any of them!

The mouse controls the player.
Collide similar coloured shapes to gain a score multiplier.
Scores are saved online unless you don't give a name.
Generally click anywhere to advance the menus.

I had the game practically done in the first day, ended up spending more time playing it than coding on Sunday. Consequentially I didn't finish up until right before the deadline.

The game is written using flashpunk, which is not included with the source. You get it from flashpunk.net.

The game doesn't have a preloader so it may take a while to load, depending on your connection. Maybe I should have thought about that earlier. Oh well.

Edit: There were some minor bugs in the original, so I'm uploading a fixed version.
Edit: Moved to Draknek's server

entries.title: Mind Operated Control Device
entries.description:
I kind of just wanted to make an entry, but I ended up getting bored kind of bored with it, and I suck with art, you can actually tell about where I started giving up. The controls are arrow keys to move, space to jump, and control to shoot, and escape to switch focus back to the player. The intended hand layout was for your left little finger to be on left control, middle and right finger to rest on z and x, and index finger on space, with the left hand on the arrow keys. Just to clear things up.

Known bugs: Hitting corners at the right angle and speed will cause you to fly really high up.

Source code may require Flash CS4.

Featuring 12 endings, a party at the beach, a mÃ©nage Ã  trois, broken ribs, a roguelike map, procedural level generation (on the borders only), more than 900 lines in my talk file, 3 gotos, and again, a staggering 12 endings.

entries.title: They've Come For Me (unfinished)
entries.description:
This was supposed to be the story of an unarmed protagonist trapped in a crumbling metropolis, one of the last survivors in a war against the machines, trying to make his way to the last enclave of human resistance...

I ran out of time and was too tired last night to finish this in time for the jam (it was originally a compo entry, but I'd bitten off more than I could chew).

All is not lost, fortunately - while doing this game, I learned a lot, and I like the idea enough that I plan to do a high-res remake in the near future.

Source is included; you'll need Allegro 4.2, 4.3 or 4.4 to build it, and it should work on pretty much any platform.  The .exe is statically linked and should not require any additional DLLs.

A cautionary note: please don't base your opinion of my skills on the art or coding style - due to the short deadline, a -lot- of shortcuts were taken and there is no error checking whatsoever (so moving any of the assets will likely make it crash).

Slash at enemies to make them collide and explode.
Some enemies may be used as platforms.

Press R to restart the level if things glitch out too badly.

entries.title: 'Rover', Swarm and Gun Turrets

Made completely in code using Java (no external images used)

The source files are now available above (link on game site not working at the moment) the code is crazy messy so I don't recommend you stare at it too long...

Hope you enjoy

entries.title: AstroVax
entries.description:
My first attempt at Ludum Dare and a relatively unpolished due to a lack of time this weekend.

Still I'm reasonably happy with the core concept even if it could do with some refining. :)

For those interested, the results from sloccount, engine is the basecode (though it was edited heavily during the weekend), testgame is the game code:

SLOC	Directory	SLOC-by-Language (Sorted)
1362    engine          cpp=1362
1098    testgame        cpp=1070,sh=28
0       top_dir         (none)

Totals grouped by language (dominant language first):
cpp:           2432 (98.86%)
sh:              28 (1.14%)

Total Physical Source Lines of Code (SLOC)                = 2,460
Development Effort Estimate, Person-Years (Person-Months) = 0.51 (6.18)
 (Basic COCOMO model, Person-Months = 2.4 * (KSLOC**1.05))

entries.title: Attract
entries.description:
A simple shoot 'em up, in which the enemies shoot themselves up.

[Note: The larger the browser window, the lower the framerate, unfortunately. If you're having issues try making the window smaller and refreshing. If you're having severe framerate issues and are using Firefox, try switching to a WebKit-powered browser such as Chrome or Safari.]

By default, all shots are attracted to you. Use this to your advantage by letting them orbit back into the enemies. Move around to gain repulsion energy, then hit 'a' to switch and send bullets flying. The scoring metric is the time taken to clear the screen.

It's a difficult game. Take your time to get used to the mechanics, and try to have a store of repulsion energy for when you get surrounded. If you need precision, get a bullet to orbit and then switch to Repel when the shot lines up. For what it's worth, my high score hovers around 60s.

Attract is written in pure JavaScript, using the HTML5 Canvas APIs. This was my first time using JavaScript for anything other than simple web design stuff, so it's highly un-optimised and probably not too clean. If things start to slow down, try closing a few tabs or resizing the browser window. As always, I doubt this will work with Internet Explorer.

entries.title: AVOIDAL
entries.description:
This game was created for the 18th Ludum Dare 48 hour game competition. The theme was "Enemies as Weapons". Development took 26 hours from August 20th-22nd, 2010.

DESCRIPTION:
You control a robot attempting to lure enemy seekers and spikes into mines before the mines explode. The difficulty ramps up as you destroy mines. You can build your chain multiplier for huge points. Chain resets when you take damage or let a mine explode. With each increase in difficulty there is a multiplier that will keep buffing your score.

PROTIP:
Send wall spikes into mines instead of using the seekers all the time--the base points are worth 5x as much!

NOTE:
AVOIDAL is a "mouse skills" type game so it was designed to be played with a mouse (or tablet perhaps.) It will be a lot harder to score well on a trackpad--sorry!

TOOLS USED:
Flash CS4 with ActionScript 3.0, Photoshop CS4, SFXR, Reason

FEEDBACK:
I really appreciate constructive feedback--especially about game balance and difficulty issues! I'll be using this feedback to release the post-compo final version. 

Thanks so much for your time playing my game!

entries.title: Brain In A Jar
entries.description:
Here is my final entry, broken as it might be.



You are Brian Inajar the Brain In A Jar (hilarious!)

The object of the game is to kill the VIP in each level ('V' guy).

To do this you take over his body and use your psychic "Kill" command!

Some commands have a mental requirement which means you can't use it without weakening the mind of the host.

When you have selected a command you can see the area which will react to you using the command.


Controls:

Mouse to guide your psychic projection
Move into a body to take it over.
Right-click to exit bodies.

Left-click to select commands, and left-click again to use it.

Also you can't restart a level. It's broken :)


Notes for compiling:

I chose to be annoying and use a custom font. I included it with the source :O


Notes for huge file sizes:

Sorry...

entries.title: Bouncecrab 2: Friends as Anemones
entries.description:
This is a Jam submission. We had about 10 (!) people working on it, with various levels of commitment. Integrated level editor, rotationally-symmetric physics, gotta-catch-'em-all gameplay, over SEVEN levels to play, speedrun mode, custom raytraced lighting... needless to say this game is "magnificent."

This game is winnable without cheating, but good luck. :)

Sequel to the smash hit "Bouncecrab" from LD17.

Linux port is possible and may be forthcoming.

entries.title: Crustacean Cannon
entries.description:
Move using the WASD keys, suck enemies into your cannon with the space bar and aim and fire with the mouse at other enemies. Once all enemies on screen are defeated (fire an enemy in your gun to defeat it) the level will progress.

You have 5 lives, which can be lost by the player falling off screen or by pressing the reset key. Once a life is lost, the level will return to it's original state. Once all lives are lost, the game is over and the player must start again.

There are 8 levels in total, complete them all for a bonus ending cutscene!

entries.title: DIE ALIEN DIE
entries.description:
Defeatall the forms of the your alien nemesis by using the mouse to guide your ship around this twisted shmup. 
Gravitate enemies towards you by clicking and then hurl them back at your opponents!

Music is from the castle crashers sound track which was released under creative commons.

Have Fun!

entries.title: Enemy Maze
entries.description:
REQUIREMENTS:

A PC with a DirectX9 capable graphics card
DirectX9 runtime
SlimDX runtime (included in installer)
.NET 3.5 runtime (included in installer)

CONTROLS/INSTRUCTIONS:

WASD to move the player
Click on a map square to create/destroy a wall
You cannot place a wall where it would block an enemy's path to the player.
Enemies will spawn only where they can reach the player.
Collect shiny things for lots of points
Avoid enemies
Trick enemies into killing eachother.
The game ends when your life runs out.

Enemy Maze is like pacman, but you get to redesign the maze as you go. And instead of attacking enemies yourself, you must trick them into killing eachother - thus the enemies themselves become your deadly weapons! (that fits the theme, right?)

The longer you survive for, the more enemies you get. Different colours move at different speeds. You cannot trap enemies by building walls around them, or hide from them by building walls around yourself.

If you dare look at the source (quite horrible) you might notice that I actually started (most of Saturday) writing the game as a tower defense where you capture and reverse engineer enemies into towers!! But I got to a certain point where it semed more fun as it was, so I tweaked that into a game.

The game was written in C#, in Visual Studio 2008 with the slimDX Direct3D wrapper used for D3D9 sprites. Windows Forms were used for the UI. Paint.NET was used for graphics.

If you have problems running the game due to slimDX, please try installing manually from the msi file included in the slimDX folder.

Please let me know of any bugs!!

entries.title: Exterminate 48
entries.description:
Exterminate! Exterminate!

INSTRUCTIONS (please read, the game isn't really self explanatory):

So you have to destroy all the robots to go to the next level. But you can't harm the robots directly only friendly fire can destroy them.

So try to go in the middle and dodge when they fire. If only one robot is left, jump to your death, you need to restart the level. Also note that they have a tendency to synchronize their firing which can help you.

Also note that the later levels are very hard so don't feel bad if you can't beat the game (11 levels total).

entries.title: Fistful of Beef
entries.description:
Fistful of Beef is a game developed by the LOVE community, using the LOVE game development framework. The objective of the game is to destroy all cattle by catching a bull with your lasso, swinging it around you and smashing all the blasted bovine to bits!

The game should be playable for Windows, Linux and OS X. The .love/source file can be used if you have LOVE 0.6.2 installed. In case one of the builds don't work for you, you could try that.

entries.title: Fratricide
entries.description:
Instructions:
1. Unzip somewhere
2. Install OpenAL with the provided installer
3. Run bin/LD18.exe
4. Enjoy

Gameplay Info:

The goal is simple: survive and get as high a score as possible. Your ship has no direct offensive weapons, but you can pull a nearby enemy ship in with your tractor beam (Z key in the default settings) to use them as a shield, use their weapons (holding Z fires continuously), or use them as a projectile (press X to throw the ship forward with enough force to destroy another enemy). 

You also have the ability to do a "force push" of sorts, by pressing X when you don't have an enemy tractor beam-ed in, any enemies near you will be pushed outward (and possibly into other enemies).

There are occasional powerups that cause slowmo or invincibility for 15 seconds.

The difficulty setting is  a decimal scale from 1 to 4, 1 being pretty tame, and 4 being ridiculous (the difficulty scales up the speed and amount of enemies, bullets etc).

Control options allow for Arrows + X/Z, WASD + Shift/Ctrl and a couple (hopefully) dvorak friendly options.

GPL'd source is included in src.zip within the Windows package.

I'll try to port to Linux, eventually.

entries.title: Graphell
entries.description:
Had a lot of fun with the theme, hope you enjoy the game too. No sounds sadly, but a lot of explosions.

Written in Java.

--Game Info--

Lost in outer space, no defenses but your trusty mining hook.

Grab enemy ships using the mouse and launch them back at their friends.

Enemy types:

Red dwarfs: tiny red drone ships, spawned by mother drones. Harmless for you but when used right they can be useful.

Plain drones: red-white, and suicidal. Don't get them too close or they will bash your hull apart.

Shooter drones: With a blue core these spit out plasma bolts like crazy.

Shield drones: A blue shield gives these units some extra bit.

Elite drones: blue-white, and out to get you. Can't outrun these babies.

Mother drones: Slow and bulky, these ships spawn red dwarfs all around. Grab one if you need some good old firepower.

Bomb drones: The pulsating ones make big badaboom.

All drone types (except dwarfs) can be combined.

Make crazy combo's to get lot's of points.

entries.title: HeadOrb
entries.description:
Use the Z and ARROW keys to move.
Collect heads to shoot with and to use as armor.
The game ends when the core gets damaged.

Tools Used:
Languages - AS3 (with the Flixel framework), Perl (used in a lame conversion script)
IDE - FlashDevelop
Graphics - ArtRage, Paint Tool SAI, Photoshop
Sfx - Sfxr
Utilities - lame, building tools, vim

entries.title: I <3 Tractor Beams
entries.description:
WINDOWS PORT NOW AVAILABLE!

Your triangular transport ship has entered an asteroid field!  You have no weapons or drilling equipment, and so must use your trusty tractor beam to defend yourself.  GO FOR THE KILL SCREEN!

Arrow keys move, pressing and holding Z activates your tractor beam.  The beam is auto targeting and will grab the nearest enemy.  While the beam is on, it is locked at a specific length.

Technical notes: This was made using the following libraries: Box2d, OpenGL, SDL, SDL_image, and SDL_mixer.  It was compiled on a Mac using XCode for the Mac version, and compiled on a Mac using a mingw port of g++ for the Windows version.  I have included the original source and the updated source for the PC port.  The only difference is that I changed the c files specifically to cpp files (I was compiling them as such in the Xcode project but I didn't want the hassle when dealing with g++) and changed the mix channels to 2 (4 was causing a crash for some reason)).  I have included the Windows makefile but I don't even know where to get that mingw toolchain anymore, so I can't really provide support there, however, if you want to compile it for windows on a windows machine, I can probably help you get set up.  If you get the game compiling, and it doesn't work when you try to run it, remember it requires some game assets that are available in the game zip file.  Also remember it requires SDL, SDL_image, and SDL_mixer, so you may need to install the runtime libraries or include them in the app file (Mac) or the project directory (Windows).

(Dev notes: Procrastinated too much, especially considering that I decided mid-development to try implementing Box2d for the first time.  It was actually very easy to add and use but it cost me time.  I still like the game, and I hope you all do too, but I wish I had more enemy types.  And yes, the game has a kill screen, and crashes nicely if you reach it.  I haven't pulled it off yet because I get too greedy in the game and have too much fun spinning enemies around.)

entries.title: Lich
entries.description:
Be sure to read the instructions below. There are no instructions in game.

This game is mostly a tech demo since it was too complicated to finish on time. This game requires Pixel shader model 2. You create skeletons using the bones of your enemies and use them to help you fight more enemies. The game was originally going to have the player collect pieces to become a lich but that is not implemented. The bones were also supposed to influence the skeleton's stats but that's also unimplemented.

Be sure to follow the brown dirt paths since I didn't have time to code proper barriers and the enemies are only on the paths. There is currently no way to "win".

Instructions:
The P key (P)ortals you between your sanctum and the outside
The I key Brings up your (I)nventory

Click the sarcophagus to bring up the skeleton maker. Click each bone and place it in the correctly labelled slot in the sarcophagus. There are tooltips to tell you what they are. Click "Create" to make your skeleton.

To destroy a skeleton select him then click the sarcophagus.

Click enemies to attack and click dead enemies to loot them. Click each item then click an inventory slot to move it there.

Right click items in your inventory to destroy them.

ESC quits.

All assets and game code were created from scratch by me. The only reason this game is Jam is because I ran out of time for the compo.

I used C++ with Ogre, CEGUI, OIS, and my Framework with helper classes.

Content was created using Blender, Photoshop, and PixPlant for the terrain textures. Images for the terrain textures were taken during a walk on Saturday.

entries.title: Out of ammo
entries.description:
Your ship has gon out of ammo but there's still enemy to fight. The only way to survive it's to dodge all enemy bullet and make them fire each other.

This time i keept the wole game easier and it took me 16 hours to complete it. I've to find a balance between too much a too few design ... maybe next ld 8)

Let me know what you think of the game.

Thanks all participants i had a great time looking your blog post, next time i'll try to be more present on the site.

2010/08/23 Added windows binary

entries.title: Money Thief
entries.description:
In Money Thief, you must steal money!

In order to avoid detection, you must become the ultimate weapon: The enemy.

To compound the matter twofold, your marks become the ultimate weapon of money-getbackery whenever they get thieved! It turns out, the money (root of all evil, et cetera) you've stolen is the TRUE enemy, turning those without it into crazy people, hellbent on retrieving what was once theirs!

Also, YOU GET TO JUMP AROUND, CLIMB ON THINGS AND STEAL SHIT.

HERE ARE SOME CONTROLS
-Arrows: MOVE
-X: STEAL
-Z: JUMP
-DOWN+X: STASH/DISGUISE/VAN
-R: RESTART LEVEL
-M: RETURN TO MAP

entries.title: Prot
entries.description: Prot is a Flash platformer. Knock all of the enemies out of each level - you can pick up and throw smaller enemies to knock out bigger ones.

entries.title: Robot Maze of Doom
entries.description: This is "Robot Maze of Doom". Made using "Game Maker 7" this treasure hunt, arcade style game makes you search the maze for objects, avoiding the bomb robots patroling it. "Making of" video may be coming soon.

entries.title: Robot Time
entries.description:
Partially finished game done by two guys. 

One who can draw, another who can program. 

However, the programmer decided to use Flixel and start programming AS3 for the first weekend in his life.

We have much more artwork done, but underestimated how hard it would be to animate it.

The game was meant to be a side-scroller beat-em-up where you took the fallen body parts of other robots and attached them to yourself.

The Screenshots show some un-implemented artwork.

entries.title: Squibble Attack
entries.description:
You must unzip the zipfile contents to run the binary.

Arrow keys to move.  Control or space to pick up and toss Squibbles.  "Q" to quit.

The Squibbles explode when they touch.  Try pickiing up a Squibble and tossing it at some others.

entries.title: Wonder Cupid
entries.description: A cutie cupid came down and he found a kissing couple.

entries.title: Zombie Conquest
entries.description:
Update: Now works on all windows versions without compatibility mode hopefully. There was a problem with the PySFML 1.6 download for windows, compiled it from source and the game should work now.

A puzzle game, featuring zombies. Don't let anybody escape to the safehouses. With two enemy types.

Shambler: your basic human enemy, as soon as they can hear a zombie within 3 tiles of them they start to move towards the nearest safehouse. If they get there then you fail in your mission.

Sniper: trained soldiers, although they can kill your zombies, you can get back at them, as years of sitting around waiting for something to happen have removed their ability to turn 180 degrees, so if you can get behind them then you can transform them easily and when they are on your side, you can use their rifle to kill far away enemies.

The zombies in this game were caused by some mysterious magical force, they can resurrect the dead corpses of slain humans. A dead zombie however, remains dead.

Controls:
*  left click on a zombie to select it
*  right click on a tile to path towards it
*  press the spacebar or end turn button to advance 1 turn
*  as a sniper, right click on an enemy to shoot.
*  press R to restart the level if you get stuck

Only managed to finish making three levels in the end, but probably will add more in a post compo version. When you get past the third level you will just get a plain level with one enemy in the corner. There are level creation tools built in but they are not particularly well designed. Read below for info on how to use them.

Really enjoyed this competition and hope to take part in future ludum dares.

Here is how to create your own level:
* Press E to enter the tile editor. Press one to use wall tiles and press zero to use floor tiles, click to paint
* Press C to enter the collision editor, paint over the walls by clicking on them to make them colidable.
* Press H to enter the entity placement editor, press 0 to place shamblers, 1 to place safehouses and 2 to place snipers. With shamblers and snipers, left click gets you a zombie and left click and shift gets you a sniper. After using the entity placement editor press R as this restarts the level and makes sure your entities will show up when you play.
* Press P to play.
* To save the level, press S.
* If you need to skip forward to your level when you start up the game U skips forwards one level.

entries.title: Alpha Channel
entries.description:
This is my first LD. This game is quite simple, but has some concepts it may take a couple of games to understand. 

By taking control of your enemies, you can block and kill the other enemies that are nearly as tough as you are. Unfortunately, while controlling an enemy, the other enemies will continue to attack you so you need to protect yourself AND make sure you don't run out of energy, freeing your slave! Sometimes running away for a bit is the best plan...

Best, though, is play and figure it out for yourself! Press F1 for in-game help.


GAMEPLAY VIDEO: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CmTGW4jAd_M


= Alpha Channel

Spooner's entry for Ludum Dare 18 - "Enemies as weapons"

This is my first LD. This game is quite simple, but has some concepts it may take a couple of games to understand. By taking control of your enemies, you can block and kill the other enemies that are nearly as tough as you are. Unfortunately, while controlling an enemy, the other enemies will continue to attack you so you need to protect yourself AND make sure you don't run out of energy, freeing your slave! Sometimes running away for a bit is the best plan...

Best, though, is play and figure it out for yourself! Press F1 for in-game help.

License: GPL v3

== Ingame help (View by pressing F1)

    It is hell being a pixel. Why can't they all just get along?


    = How to play =

      * Red is evil; Red wants to hurt you!

      * Take control of Red, when it comes near, and use it to protect yourself from the other Reds!

      * Controlling Red is strenuous and will use up your limited energy reserves (Blueness).

      * All colours hurt colours that aren't the same. Green isn't too painful, though :)


    = Controls =

      * Arrow keys or WASD: Move self (or a controlled Red).

      * Space or Return: Take/relinquish control of Red.

      * P: Pause

      * Control+Q: Exit game.


== Compatibility

Runs in a 640x480 window. Windows, Linux and OS X [10.6 only].


== Where to get a copy of the game from

* Project: http://github.com/Spooner/spooner_ld_18
* Downloads: http://github.com/Spooner/spooner_ld_18/downloads
* Repository: git://github.com/Spooner/spooner_ld_18.git


== v1.1 (2010-08-24)

  Ludum Dare #18 entry compatibility update

* Fixed CTD in Linux.
* Fixed font rendering in Linux by changing the font (also changed font used in Windows to keep things the same).
* Made OS X executable.

== v1.0 (2010-08-22)

  Ludum Dare #18 entry

entries.title: Atop Mt. Brawlalot
entries.description:
The horde is coming, and boy does it have its collective panties in a collective bunch! Your time on Mt. Brawlalot is coming to a close - or is it? You decide!

Use the grumbling masses against themselves! Grab one and spin it using *state-of-the-art* physics technology!

(***physics technology may not be state-of-the-art, ie. some bugs that I never could iron out entirely. I am probably using HingeJoints in ways they were never meant to be, and I don't mean that as self-flattery.)

Built with Unity, Photoshop, Audacity, FL-studio, and 3ds-max.

Textures based on photos taken Saturday morning, I'll have those up along with the source code soon.

UPDATE: Source finally uploaded successfully!! Source is a mix of photos, textures, sounds, project files ... and a Unity package. Go wild!

entries.title: Attack of the Jartos
entries.description:
Hey all,

This is my first Ludum Dare ever! I originally intended to compete but time was too short for me to submit in time. I teamed up with my biz partner [ @DirkRugged ], got a wicked song from GreaseMonkey [ @iamgreaser ] and completed the game in time for the jam.

Please be candid! We look forward to your comments.

[ @vieko ]

entries.title: Birds of Prey
entries.description:
Java applet; runs in browser but requires Java 1.6.0_10 or newer. Windows and Linux only.

Click, drag and release a bird to send it flying through the air, crashing into other birds! Bring as many birds down as you can.

There is no end goal, just have fun flinging birds around. Or make up a goal. How many birds can you kill in two minutes? There, there's your goal.

entries.title: BOMBCRASH
entries.description:
BOMBCRASH
by Xander Davis - www.xanderdavis.com
FlashBuilder 4 + ActionScript 3.0 + Flixel

This is my first entry in Ludum Dare!

You're an unarmed robot engineer and humanity's only hope from the rampant bomb-bots! Run and dash through the levels of the space station to reach hacking terminals, where you can set groups of robots to self-destruct and turn them against other robots! As you do, don't let them hit you, but lure them to crash into other bots!

Single-player | Top-down action | 2 Tutorial levels + 3 Combat Levels!

Arrows = Movement
Z = Dash

Created from scratch in 48 hours.  Had a "blast" doing this! Looking forward to the next Ludum Dare event! :P

entries.title: Bubble Tag
entries.description:
Build a giant amoeboid castle out of the remains of your defeated opponents.

<arrows> or <w, a, s, d> to move
<mouse> to fire

Enemy castles are green. Destroy the core of a castle to render it neutral. Once you have defeated an enemy castle, you can harvest any remaining components by walking over them.

Take your spoils back to your castle, and build by clicking and dragging.

entries.title: Clinging to Life
entries.description:
This is my first time participating in Ludum Dare and hence I of course estimated time requirements badly. I live and learn though!

In Clinging to Life you play a ghost with the ability to possess living beings. While possessing them you gain access to their abilities (if any).
All the controls are ingame except for "Press R to restart the current level".
 
I'm a coder by heart, so my art is really not the best. 

Anyway I hope you enjoy the game, I'd like to belive that I managed to show my concept!

(Note: In case this is not the text you remember it's because my entry for unknown reason decided to vanish for a while!)

entries.title: Death Wheel
entries.description:
Attach the bodies of sword-monsters to a giant spinning wheel of death. Survive 8 waves of enemies to win the game.

To attack an enemy, you need to swipe one of your swords at it's rear, several times. When an enemy dies, position one of your wheel's empty spokes onto the rear of the enemy to add it to your arsenal.

Made with Unity, Blender, Sfxr, and GIMP.

entries.title: Doors and some other stuff
entries.description:
This is what I managed to come up with during the extended weekend. I've had this idea for a while, and now that I have the base engine going, I'm going to work more on it.

The game has only one level and can't be 'beaten', as there's no congratulary message, but the puzzle itself can be solved, i.e. you can bring the orb to th pedestal. The puzzle's probably too hard for a starter, but I hope you have fun!

entries.title: Double Bounce
entries.description: A glowy mashup of pool, putt-putt golf, and air hockey. If you create new courses in the editor, please upload them to the server so other people can play & rate 'em.

entries.title: Dr. Stein's Super Weapons VS Giant Robots
entries.description:
The game is very short but fun.
This is my first LD. Have mercy.

entries.title: From The Clutches Of Satan Himself
entries.description:
Simple game, made in about 5 hours to make up for the terrible mess I made of my RTS compo attempt.

Read Post:
http://www.ludumdare.com/compo/2010/08/23/from-the-clutches-of-satan-himself/

Watch Timelapse:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lLnPGWhUeug

entries.title: Kanbran
entries.description:
Arrow keys to move and jump. Land on enemies, pull them around and force them into the ground to make them shoot each other.

Infinite arcade gameplay, try to get a high score before you perish.

Post mortem: For once I focused mainly on gameplay design. Graphics remained in the placeholder stage, and there was no complex technical code that distracted me. I did however do a bunch of other real-life things during the compo, so actual time spent was probably less than 10 hours. Sketched on various slightly different ideas before I really started working on this one. I'm fairly happy with it, though I somewhat regret not doing proper graphics. Remake perhaps?

entries.title: LDSpace
entries.description: Instructions in text file in zip, this may/may not work on Linux or OSX, it's untested.

entries.title: Maze Shooter
entries.description:
COMES FREE WITH A MENU SCREEN!

You are a brave warrior who has fallen into a robot-infested labyrinth. You have no ammo or any means of destroying the robots.

Maybe you can still figure out a way to survive.

If there's only 1 robot left, you will be able to disable it even without ammo. So the goal is to kill all the robots except 1.

NOW WITH "HARD" OPTION!



The exe version can run on its own. The source version requires:
- Python 2.5.4
- pygame 1.9.1
- (optional) py2exe 0.6.9

To run: main.py ; or MazeShooter.exe
To compile: compile2exe.py


- Yoni

entries.title: OrbIt
entries.description:
Made in 14 hours.

All the info you need is either included in the readme, or is on the title screen.

There would have been more orb types had i started coding on Saturday, but this was made all on Sunday.
I'll probably add them in the future, but this is my competition build.

Have fun guys! Let me know what you think in the comments!

entries.title: Over Ambitious Necromancer
entries.description:
I managed to get a lot of the important stuff working, but a few critical things are missing;

1) most of the code is absolutely HORRID. However, its a nice change to have an excuse to "just make it work".
2) Camera is dodgy
3) No win or lose condition
4) Level is just a big concrete arena with no features
5) No enemy spawning, and enemy AI is limited to per-creature.

entries.title: PuzzaBOMB
entries.description:
PuzzaBOMB is a simple action-puzzle game.  The objective is to lure the time-bombs toward castles which contain powerups.  Collect the glowing powerups to go the to next level.  

When a bomb is flashing red, it is about to explode!

Features:  Five levels, including a "speed round" where the bombs get really spammy.  Hand-painted textures.  Music featuring me on electric bass and mandolin.  Online high score database using php and mysql.  Really damn high framerates.  nVidia Physx rigid body physics simulation.  And lots of explosions!

Programmed entirely in javascript.

You can watch a streaming flash video of the gameplay here:
http://www.orangeview.net/puzzabomb

There are three versions available: 
- Windows (does not require shockwave: uses directX) 
- Mac OSX (does not require shockwave: uses openGL)
- Online (in any browser: uses adobe shockwave) 

You can get Adobe Shockwave here:
http://get.adobe.com/shockwave/

Use the arrow keys to move.  Have fun, and thanks for playing!  This was a blast to make.  Ludum Dare ROCKS.

P.S.  Double ZOMBIE Rainbow!  =)

entries.title: Recycling Defense
entries.description:
To compile under Ubuntu, make sure you've got SDL devel packages and run make. To exit the game press q. Otherwise, pretty straight forward tower defense-type game. Let me know how it goes!

Windows port now available!

entries.title: Revenge of the Living Dead
entries.description:
This game was inspired by the "Land of the Dead" movie, where a zombie starts to get smart and command the others against humans.

Objectives & Game Mechanics
Kill all people by turning them into zombies (just touch them) or making the shooters hit them by mistake.
People who became zombies will help you to kill more people (you turn your ENEMIES into your WEAPONS :P). Their normal behavior is AI controlled, but you can give commands to them.

Game Controls
Arrow Keys: Move
Shift: Commands your nearby allies to come close to you
Alt: Commands your nearby allies to go away from you
Ctrl: Commands your nearby allies to move as you wish (control them with the arrow keys)
Z: Commands your nearby allies to disperse
X: Commands your nearby allies to attack the person closest to you

* This game has background music and sound effects. If you're using Java Web Start and any of them seems broken to you, try downloading the game zip file instead. *

Development Details
Language: Java
Engine: JGame
IDE: NetBeans
Images: Gimp
SFX: sfxr
BGM: Wolfram Tones

entries.title: Spacenoid
entries.description:
Spacenoid = Space Invaders + Arkanoid

The included source is messy, so I'll clean up later (after the LD).

entries.title: Super Collide-Em-Up
entries.description:
Mouse to move. Don't let the asteroids hit Earth!

Created with FlashPunk using Box2D for physics. Rendering done partially with FlashPunk and partially with the Flash display list for no good reason.

entries.title: Trust your Enemy
entries.description:
edit: Added a bugfix after deadline: probability of trust tower was calculated wrong. Was fixed by changing a single character. The rest is unnaffected/unchanged!


This is my first Ludum Dare. The game is 'finished' but untuned and there is no tutorial (see readme). No optimizations, no testing on other PC's. 

I spend too much time on the GUI part yesterday. I will polish this game later and put it on my website, because I like the idea of the game very much and want to polish it!

;-)

entries.title: Zombies as Weapons
entries.description:
== Zombies as Weapons ==

An entry for Ludum Dare 18.
By Philip Buchanan.

Finding yourself surrounded by zombies, but without any weapons, you must use your bare hands to fight off the invading hoards.

== Controls ==

-Move using the arrow keys.
-Control your 'hand' with the mouse.
-Click to punch or kick.
-Hold the mouse button down to grab hold of a zombie, and release to throw it.

entries.title: Andrew The Angry Salmon
entries.description:
Andrew The Angry Salmon is a puzzle platformer. Adrew shoots rockets with his dual bazookas. Aim your rockets to nuclear Jellos to explode the wobblers so sky high.

Use arrows to move and jump, X will shoot and R will reset the map. I tried to compose some tracks for the game but they came out so horrible that i didn't want to implement them. :S

entries.title: Attack Of The Weapons
entries.description:
As I submit this, there are still 20 hours left to the competition, but I just don't think I'll be able to do any work nor upload it tomorrow. If I do, I'll be sure to add sounds and maybe some other weapons before the deadline. There currently is about 12 actual hours of work in this. As usual, wish I had more free time the weekend. Probably be taking off for the next LD.

I decided to take the theme quite litteraly. As such, the enemies are the weapons. Like, litteraly. They're weapons. And they're shooting at you. Thing is, you are a weapon too! Shoot back at em using the mouse. Move with WASD. Action (swap weapons, go down stairs) with spacebar. The goal is to get to the very bottom of the bottomless dungeon. Find the stairs on each randomly generated level to the next!

entries.title: Biker's Rebellion
entries.description:
135 seconds (3 levels of 45 seconds each) of a Spy Hunter style vertical scroller where the only objective is to stay alive while avoiding angry drivers. Each level will bring more and more enraged vehicles; get them to drive into a gas station for bonus points!

W - accelerate
S - brake
A - turn left
D - turn right
Left Shift - Provides a short boost of higher acceleration maneuverability.

Avoid cars and stay on the road to get a higher score. Bonus points if you crash cars into gas stations! Avoid debris because it will hinder your acceleration and turning speeds.

Three levels with increasing difficulty in all, see the highest score you can get!

Windows and XNA required, sorry :( but the Windows zip file includes the installation files if you don't have them. The source code is a horrendous spaghetti mess due to bad preparation and frantic coding.

My first Ludum Dare :D
Dev blog: http://ryanhallcs.wordpress.com

links.label: Source (and EXE if you don't want to install)

entries.title: Bug Them All!
entries.description:
First, sorry for the lame name :)

How to run
----------

Bug Them All! is written in Python, and has only been tested with CPython 2.6.
Apart from the standard library, it makes use of two third party libraries:
    - PySFML, a multimedia framework
        http://www.sfml-dev.org/download.php
    - FluentXML, an XML library, used to parse the map SVG
        http://fluentxml.last-exile.org/
        (included in the source tree to ease the use)

To launch the game, just type ./run


How to play
-----------

I bet you know that enemies, are, by definition, dumb.
But maybe you don't know they can panic easily?
It's your chance to use them against their allies!
Indeed, you can bug them, literally. And they'll just panic and panic!
If an enemy panic too much, he'll start attacking his allies!

However, you don't run faster than the enemies, and you don't have any weapon.
The only way to survive is to create confusion in the enemy lines with your bugs!

To move, use the LEFT, RIGHT, and TOP arrows.
To release a bug, press SPACE, then, press SPACE again to start bugging an enemy.

Beware, however, you have only 3 bugs, and those have limited life time!
(although they bug your enemy until they die)


About the data and the tools used
---------------------------------

I used Inkscape with a Wacom tablet to produce most of the graphics,
with the exception of the bug sprites. For these ones, I used mtpaint and The Gimp.

The map was made using Inkscape, too.

The audio samples directly come from sfxr.

entries.title: Bugger
entries.description:
It doesn't really follow the theme but whatever.
The scores are messed up, but I'm out of time.
Hope you like it! :-)

entries.title: Dodge
entries.description: Decided to make a quick jam entry. Total development time: about one hour. It's just about the simplest thing that anyone could make for this theme. I did however end up bypassing Unity's physics and collision detection systems, which is something I aim to explore further in future projects. My compo entry tries to somewhat work with the Unity physics and collision and it's kinda terrible in that area.

entries.title: Dude, that's my bullet
entries.description:
The basic idea of the game is really simple, you can't shoot and have to make the turrets kill each other, or themselves.

You move your ship with your mouse, when you move your ship near a turret it will shoot at you, then you can dodge the bullet or reflect it with your shield. If the bullet hits a turret it will do damage to the turret.

When you have your shield raises you receive no damage, but the shield is drained while in use, and regenerates slowly when unused. You raise your shield by holding the left mouse button.

Once there is only one turret alive you release the megabomb and win the level.

Hope you like it.

entries.title: Evade ?
entries.description:
Warning before you waste too much time playing this - it's totally unfinished and not really ready to be played. I thought I post it anyhow, for interests sake. Note that even though this is in the Jam, I was aiming for a Compo-compliant game, and as far as I can tell it is.

The idea for this game was inspired by the old Short Circuit game, and something fiona said on IRC ... "taking control of robots". It is common knowledge that all robots are evil and your enemies, so this amounts to using "enemies as weapons". So there is you, robots, and terminals that you can use to take control of them. The idea was to use the robots to crash into each other, and also crash through walls to help you exit the level.

In it's current state, pressing 'A' button (=Z key) while at a terminal will make a robot run in the direction that was last moving. One terminal is tied to one robot. You can crash two robots together and they die. Most testing was done zoomed out on the map so you could see everything, but for actually playing the game I think it's more fun if you can't see the whole map at one time. Problem still to be solved: controlling off-screen robots without things becoming confusing and frustrating (a radar HUD maybe ?).

Timelapse for a chunk of the 48 hour part: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oeChoj4nJQc

Still needs: sound, proper sprite graphics, more than just test levels, robot waypoints, scoring and clearer goals etc. My mistake: trying to learn a new engine (Akihabara) during the compo+jam. Postmortem blog post to come.

entries.title: Fail-Deadly
entries.description:
FAIL-DEADLY designed and developed by Josh Sutphin.
More stuff: http://www.third-helix.com

So this is basically a simple RTS where you play as both sides.

I took a loose interpretation of the "Enemies As Weapons" theme: you are a shadowy third party using two enemies against each other to achieve some secret, grander goal.

Incidentally, this is the first indie game I've ever designed that contains blood. So that's a thing. :P

entries.title: Grabman
entries.description:
NOTE: Click "Web (Flash)" to play the official pre-deadline submission. If you get annoyed with the spikes hitting you when you aren't actually touching them, you can play the "Bugfix (Post-deadline)" version, which fixes a couple of annoying bugs. In the interest of fairness, please judge only on the pre-deadline version.

Play as Jon Grabman, a possibly naked man who likes grabbing enemies and using them for his own greedy, cake-acquiring benefits.

Please read the instructions on the title screen for the controls, and please don't give up if you die, it's fairly hard! Apologies for any bugs that may spring up.

See if you can activate the hidden level editor mode! (Note: buggy, and intended as a developer-only tool. Only included as an easter egg!)

entries.title: HAckBotz
entries.description:
You are a roboticist trapped in a secret government with a bunch of malfunctioning robots. Thankfully, even though you are unarmed, you've got skillz in that you can hack most of the robots (except for the orange ones) given the SX3000 replacement circuit board. Hacking requires you sneak up behind a robot when he is not looking and touch him (make sure you have a circuit board and are standing on the ground - not in the air).  The goal: get out of the facility with your life intact.

NOTES *) The preloader does not appear to be working so you
         might have to wait a few seconds while staring at
         what looks like an almost empty webpage.
      0) In normal mode, Z = jump
      1) Orange robots are NOT hackable!
      2) You must NOT be in the air when you attempt to hack a robot or you WILL fail.
      3) Hacks don't last forever, so get done with the bot quickly.
      4) It is required that you hack certain bots to open certain security gates. TrackBot opens the Blue gates. WheelBot opens the Red gates.
      5) In hacked mode: Z = jump  X = fire
      6) Something I failed to get into the game instructions - the exit to each level looks kind of like an elevator door.
      7) Stuck on a level with no way to finish it? No problem, just press 'Q' and the level will be reset ... but you will lose a life in the process.

entries.title: HelgasWorldDomination
entries.description:
This is our first game, we've made for LudumDare. ingame you will find a short explanation how the game works and what to do. We spend about 16 hours of coding and planing to this game. We hope you will enjoy playing it.

It is necessary to have jre6 for playing the game.

entries.title: HochEmpor

Metagun

entries.title: Robots <3 Monster

You have no weapons and are attacked (for no reason?) by evil robots. Avoid the robots and trick them to crash into each other! (you can even do combos!)

If you get too many robot hugs you die!

Programmed in Unity using C#

Graphics done in Photoshop.

entries.title: Rotate!

Rotate the world around you and avoid getting killed by your enemies, take them down and use them to relodad yourself.

Note: rotating and firing takes your energy awey, be careful!

I think the game has some charm.  tons of notes in the source itself.  Update: final version is there now.  I know it works on various pc versions of IE and FF, apparently on mac it doesn't get focus right away but after that it works there as well.

entries.title: Stop That Hero!
entries.description:
That dastardly Hero is at it again! 

Create monsters at your towers to try to stop him! 
If he liberates your tower, any enemies spawned from it will be destroyed! Also, you can't use the tower anymore!

If he reaches your castle, you lose! 
If you can defeat him (and wouldn't you know it, Hero-types always have multiple lives), you get to be comfortably evil once again.

Unfortunately, he'll be able to find weapon upgrades and health strewn about the world, so it won't be easy! 

(Secret Pro Tip: If the game is too slow for your tastes, press "F" to speed it up!)

entries.title: Stupid Squares
entries.description:
Tag the stupid squares by pressing LEFT SHIFT and then make them explode by holding LEFT SHIFT near one of them.

Tagging consumes your health (the more squares are near you, the more health you lose), but you can gain it back by eating the "pills" they leave behind when they explode.

Not as fun as I would have liked it to be, but still playable. Maybe you can create an interesting map yourself!

Thanks to Lanael for the FreeBSD build.

entries.title: Wherein Obstacles [...] IN SPACE
entries.description:
Full title: "Wherein obstacles should be avoided and thereafter repurposed as weapons - IN SPACE"

Sadly has no sound at all.

entries.title: AfterDark
entries.description:
Hi guys, here is my entry!
My second Ludum Dare ended up with me making this baby.

The theme was 'Enemies as weapons", which i played around with a bit. In this game, the "enemies" are the falling blocks, which kill you if they fall on you, and you use them as a "weapon" to climb higher, and earn more points.
More is explained in the in-game instructions.
I know it's easy to change the highscore, but don't go around bragging if you do.

All in all, i'm /REALLY/ happy with this, considering it's taken about 32h. I've got school in six hours, so i need to get some sleep. I might make a Jam entry with some nice ambient music off the interwebs tommorrow afternoon.

But for now, have fun, enjoy, and GOODNIGHT!

EDIT: I've added a timelapse. Also, about the sourcecode: the game was made in Game Maker 8, and i used some of the pro functions. to open it you'll need GM8, and to build it you'll need GM8Pro, or you will have to change those functions.

I have now added a post-compo version above. Please give it a go :D
New features:
-Music :)
-Replaced arrows with something slightly more obvious
-Some Neat gfx
-short invincibility after respawning
-credits

I haven't included source for the new version because of size, but if you want it give me a shout at info.clockworkgames (at) gmail.com

entries.title: Camma The Huntress
entries.description: A druid who walks around banging evil spirits into each other.

entries.title: Change of Hearts
entries.description:
Instructions are provided in game. The basic concept is that you have to kill as many enemies as possible, but you can't do it using your own body alone, as you're not strong enough! Press Spacebar to take over other people's bodies to keep fighting, and don't stop until you can't fight no more!

Known issues: If you miss taking over somebody's body, you'll need to restart the game!
*Punching animation won't show sometimes
*Enemies will punch each other
*If an enemy if above you, he will think you're at the same Y position as him

links.label: Source (Note: Sloppy coding and requires Flash CS4(Coded in AS2))

entries.title: EA X3000
entries.description:
Yeah, this was mostly just for me testing real-time enemies, lol not exactly expecting anything good from it. I had to downgrade the project into something smaller and easier since I had very little time added to the already small amount of time provided, but hey, it was a good experience.

Move with the arrow keys, use space to shoot your enemy absorber ray, if it hits an enemy you get a new power with the gun based on the enemy which you also press space to use

*Soldiers = commando fist
*Bolts = lightning
*Wolf = claw(slightly better than fist)
*Bat = flight(test-room only)

note that the movement is tile-based since I didn't have that much time, good luck

entries.title: Enemy of the Solid State
entries.description:
Apologies for the scrappiness of the artwork, and also the lack of spell checking and proof reading... I just got it finished in time! ^o^ (The chances of me redrawing the backgrounds one day is quite high. I only had 10 minutes for each one.)

Silly piece of crap I made using RenPy.

entries.title: Fire, Fire, Where You Are
entries.description:
You play as a firefighter, fighting his greatest enemy...  Fire (You didn't see that coming?).  His weapon of choice?  Fire (Again, really I thought you'd get that).

The full title was given by my 4 year old daughter:
Fire, fire, where you are, I'm going to fight you with a fire department

Use wasd or arrows to move.  Move and click the mouse to set fires.  Use these fires to burn away fuel from the expanding wild fires.  There's also a nice surprise in there that fits all too well ;)

Note: There's a bug with the deltaT between levels, so to minimize its impact, make sure that you're not moving when a level ends.  I'll see if I can fix the library which causes it when I get home tonight.

Edit: I think I got it.  The original (bad) version can be found here:
http://code.bluedinosaurs.com/open/LD%2018%20-%20Jonny%20D%20-%20Fire%20Fire%20Where%20You%20Are%20-%20bad.zip

entries.title: Grabitas
entries.description: Arrow keys to move, Z to grab, P to pause, M to mute.

entries.title: Hacking4Dummies
entries.description:
As a hacker you need to take over servers, to use their powers to hack more servers. Dunno if that fits the theme.
I'm happy I finished and I'm some kind of proud of the voice-acting / music /gfx stuff :D
thanks 4 watching

Bugfixes applied. Updated Binary and Source available.

entries.title: How to Save the World
entries.description:
The game is kind of like asteroids but without the classic weapon.  Also, it is a 2D scroller so objects won't wrap.  The idea is that you are piloting a space tug.  Grab an object with your tractor beam and swing it around to smash other objects.   There are also evil smiley faces which of course are trying to kill you.

There's no real way to win - just try to advance in levels and get a high score, which is a Big Win in my book =)

Maximize the window for the best playing experience.  There's a readme.txt file in the zip that should explain everything.  It should be good to go on Windows XP, Vista and Win7.   

In hindsight, it's no tetris, or even pong for that matter, but it was fun to write and was definately a challenge =)

entries.title: Illusion
entries.description:
The aim of the game is to trick the enemy into killing themselves and each other using the Illusion based skills of the character.

The first spell creates a decoy version of yourself. If the enemy sees this decoy it will think it's you and begin firing. The bullets will go straight through, hopefully killing any enemies on the opposite side.

The second illusion tricks the enemy into thinking a pit (the black tiles) is a perfectly walkable tile. It will then either randomly wander into it, or walk across it while trying to chase you. Falling to his doom.

The third illusion is an upgrade to the standard decoy. Any bullet hitting this decoy will bounce back towards the attacker.

Also, at any point you can turn yourself into a rock. If the enemy does not see you do this, it may just walk straight past you, giving you a chance to get out of harms way.

Also. You have a hat. So do the enemy, but yours is better.

- Controls
- In-Game
WASD movement
Left-Click - Select/Cast illusions
Right-Click - Cancel casting.
Space - Don your awesome rock based disguise.

- Menu
WS - Cycle options
Space - Select

Requires the VC++ 2010 Redistrobutable. Sorry about that.

http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyID=a7b7a05e-6de6-4d3a-a423-37bf0912db84&displaylang=en

Next time I'll use something more cross-platform. =]

entries.title: LunarMind
entries.description:
Here is my very short (and broken/buggy) game!

Arrow Keys to move.
Hold spacebar to mind control.
Keep holding spacebar to blow up mind controlled enemy.
Press E to flick switches.
Press R to reset the current screen.

UPDATE:
I've taken the downloads down since the game was more broken and buggy than I initially thought! Better luck next compo I guess.

entries.title: Minion Swarm
entries.description:
A sidescroller shooter created for the Lundum Dare jam. This is also my first Lundum Dare attempt. 

Your task is to defeat the enemies, using their own characteristics against them. 

I originally wanted to do something more complicated, but due to my busy schedule, this was all I could do. 

More information on the game, including a brief log of events, is within the game itself. Just hit F1.

Created with Game Maker.

entries.title: Modulopod
entries.description:
I was going to do the competition proper, but a friend wanted to participate so I helped him out instead and took advantage of the relaxed rules a little. ^_^

Use WASD or Arrow keys to move. Aim with the mouse and click and hold the mouse button to fire.

entries.title: Purple
entries.description:
An arena shooter, where you must lead your purple guys into battle against the orange guys.

Your shots will turn enemies into explosive slaves. Right click to detonate them.

Arrow keys or WASD to move.
Aim with the mouse.
Left click to fire enslaving ray.
Right click to detonate slaves.

If the purple guys reach the orange guys' spawn position, you win. But there's no game over screen to let you know.

The difficulty was intended to come from attaining high scores. But I didn't get to make a scoring system. The game is pretty much devoid of challenge at the moment.

Made using Unity 2.6 and sfxr.

entries.title: Rubber and Glue
entries.description:
Make sure to keep the compliments and to send back those hurtful words! Reject the insults!

Background: I'm visiting a friend this weekend and don't have access to most of my tools (e.g. tablet, scanner and alone time).  I did, however, want to compete in some shape or form.  I woke up early Saturday morning and coded this for kicks.

entries.title: SpaceFreak Snack
entries.description:
SpaceFreak is hungry! 
Guide a stray martian to safety. Kick evil space blobs at SpaceFreak to slow him down.

You will probably be digested.

entries.title: Survive 60
entries.description:
Arrow keys move.
Up, z, or c to jump.
X or space to pick up the guy you are standing on.
X or space again to throw.

You can touch the tops but not the sides or bottom of the enemies.

STAY ALIVE FOR SIXTY SECONDS



Note: You aren't getting pulled toward the center, the camera is catching up to you.

entries.title: Tactics Lasso!
entries.description:
Tested on Windows XP SP2.

Use WASD keys to move, mouse to aim.
The object is to lasso other enemies and throw them
as projectiles, in order to clear the screen.

To lasso, click and hold, while tracking the enemy with your
mouse. Then, keep holding whilst swinging. Aim and release.

Only 5 levels included. Hey, I ran out of time! :-)

IMPORTANT:
You will need to have the latest DirectX installed
http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=2da43d38-db71-4c1b-bc6a-9b6652cd92a3&displaylang=en

entries.title: The Adventures of Rubberman!
entries.description: Use your mouse to move Rubberman around to deflect the insults hurled toward the innocent critters right back at them! Make it through all three levels to make it to the safety of the castle.

entries.title: Unarmed and Dangerous
entries.description:
Unarmed and Dangerous!

Written for Ludum Dare #18 (Theme: Enemies as Weapons)

By bluescrn ([email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ / www.bluescrn.net)

Controls
--------
Move: Arrow keys (or WASD)/ Note - you can jump 1-tile gaps by moving over them!

Restart Level: Space

Quit: Esc

To complete the level, you need to eliminate all nasty spiky enemies from the level... To do that, you'll have to
make them kill each other!

Notes
--------
- If you're missing a D3DX DLL, try downloading it here - http://www.toymaker.info/Games/html/d3dx_dlls.html
- Requires shader 2.0. May crash unpleasantly if you don't have support!
- Written in C++, D3D, FMOD, and was written with this basecode: http://www.bluescrn.net/LD48/LD48Base.zip
- It's terribly inefficient. Sorry. May set a new world record for number of single-poly draw calls in a  frame?
- The 'withoutbloom' .exe should run a bit faster on laptops/slow GPUs, but doesn't look as nice
- Yes, level 5 is possible
- Level 6 should be possible... but I've not done it myself yet(!)
- No, you can't complete level 7. If you get that far, you've won!

entries.title: Undermine
entries.description:
Use the arrow keys.

Goal #1: Stay alive. Use left, right, and up arrows (or Z) to move and jump around.

Goal #2: Wreck enemies. Use down arrow (or X) to duck into safety and slide around. Pop up beneath enemies.

Goal #3: Figure out how to force the invader back from whence it came (space).

~ made in Flash, using Flashpunk. The web link will work for more than just computers running Windows.

Things I did not create during the 48 hours:
Flashpunk (a great library for making flash games -- see flashpunk.net)
standingwave2 (an as3 library for manipulating audio stuff)
Mover.as (a class I created long ago; I use it in pretty much everything I make; I hear that's allowed)

entries.title: Wenemies -- The Weapon Enemy Simulator

entries.title: Demography

entries.title: Ennameez
entries.description:
Please spend 30 seconds reading the instructions!  You can then read the tips after you've played a bit, if you like.



I really wanted to do something other than "throw enemies at enemies" or "take control of enemies", etc.

Then it occurred to me that the enemies don't have to be the player's enemies.  So I based the game on picking up symbols of things, matching pairs of mutual enemies (e.g., democrats and republicans), and using the contention between these natural enemies to power your gun.

I only implemented one type of (pretty lame) bad guy for you to shoot, so the actual shooty gameplay isn't as compelling as I'd like.  I also spent about half my time in Photoshop, since I'm a coder, not an artist, and I was very slow at making the icons.

Done in Flash, with FlashPunk.  Sfxr used for sound effects.

entries.title: illumynate
entries.description:
aim the flashlight with the mouse
WASD to move
SPACE toggles flashlight
R forces a respawn
X to start game, and to close messages

Press C to skip the intro story

Notes:
Keep in mind that the flashlight effects last a while after you turn it off- sometimes, it more effective to flick it on/off than to keep it on.

Also, there's only 1 ending to the game.  Don't get confused!


This was my first LD, and I had a lot of fun!  I used it to learn how to use flixel and flashDevelop.
  

I liked the idea of making a game where the player couldn't directly kill anything. Explore, play the game, and have fun!



I'm happy with how much I got done in 48 hours.  I got enough sleep each night, and I even spent much of the second day at the Renaissance festival!
  
After having spent several hours optimizing my game for a better framerate, I was both elated and upset when I found out the the .swf runs much faster standalone than when tested from flashdevelop!

entries.title: Isolation
entries.description:
So, after tireless effort, I'm finally done.
